title: Do you want a tiny house? Build Small, Live Large tour, classes (photos)
text:
The Portland couple who put the spotlight on living in an ultra small home
Augusta Quirk/IFC -- "Portlandia" filmed at their tiny house hotel -- have organized a trio of events clustered around the Nov. 6 Build Small, Live Large Summit .
Longtime tiny house advocates Kol Peterson and Deb Delman will have a tour of accessory dwelling units on Nov. 7, a tour of the six custom houses on wheels at Caravan-The Tiny House Hotel on Nov. 8 and Peterson will teach a class on designing and building micro homes on Nov. 15.
Here are the details:
More than 2,400 people registered for Peterson's spring tour of small, extra homes built legally on Portland city lots. The self-contained second homes were inside converted garages, basements and spare rooms of a house or were detached dwellings in the backyard.
Tour goers on the Build Small, Live Large: Portland's Accessory Dwelling Unit Tour Fall 2015 from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. on Saturday, Nov. 7, will be able to explore 10 accessory dwelling units not seen on previous tours.
Tickets are $35, with a $5 discount until Oct. 24, and can be picked up Nov. 7 at Caravan-The Tiny House Hotel, 5009 NE 11th Ave., Portland. Guided tours of the ADUs are available for $95 to 14 people.
On Sunday, Nov. 8, Caravan's tiny houses that are hand built on trailers will be open from 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. to people who have made reservations ($10). Tours are conducted about once a month and are limited to 100 people.
And from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. on Sunday, Nov. 15, Peterson will teach a class on costs, zoning regulations, small space design, building and managing an accessory dwelling in Portland ($95). The Nov. 8 class has sold out.
